intro: Erigeron granatensis, commonly known as the granate fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, white pubescence. Erigeron granatensis is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun.
